title: New version change theme and related problems
content:
First, after the newest version of the desktop browser auto loaded, the colors theme I had been using was gone. It is saved, but I can't seem to get it established as the default theme.

More important—and I'm furious about this—I kept getting message about hidden tabs. It was quite annoying. I clicked on "delete extension" because I wanted to stop getting these messages. Instead, it deactivated my Speed Dial extension, and I can't figure out how to reactivate it. This extension is essential to just about everything I do on the web. It would take me days to reconstruct, and even then I doubt I could complete recreate it.

Please tell me how I can reactivate the Speed Dial extension. It is still listed among my extension, but it is listed as deactivated.
creator: wrhackman

title: Firefox forgets custom server certificate exceptions in certificate manager
content:
When I add certificate exceptions, such as for my router's self-signed certificate, Firefox forgets the exception at seemingly random intervals. Often this happens in several days. In one case it was overnight. This has been going since at least early 2023, probably a year.

In noticed Firefox also forgets settings like "allow popups" set on a site (like on Gmail for example), but not necessarily at the same time as certificate exceptions are forgotten. Other settings don't seem to be changed or forgotten.

These problems occur on different Macs using the same Mozilla account. Refreshing Firefox has made no difference.
creator: jondagle

title: I can't log into my xfinity account
content: I can't log into my xfinity account. I get the following: Secure Connection Failed An error occurred during a connection to oauth.xfinity.com. PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR
creator: kathyglenn

title: Clear History clear does NOT clear the history
content:
Hi,

I clear my history every time I close my browser. And I periodically clear my history during my sessions.

When I open a new Window or Tab and begin to type an address, Firefox prompts me with websites I have previously visited that begin with the same letters. Firefox should NOT know my previous websites, if it has cleared my history.

In the attached image I typed in the letter "m" and Firefox prompted me with a recent pages I visited page and a list of other pages I have visited, at least one of them from a week or 2 ago.

Obviously, Firefox is not Clearing the History. It maybe clearing some of the history, but not ALL of the history.

Love the Browser. This should be fixed.

Thank you
creator: bikeshills

title: Tammy Baldwin's website - accessible via Safari, not Firefox
content:
Can anyone explain why that would be? Everything else seems to be working fine, and I can access the site with Safari with no issues. Not looking for feedback on the candidate or to provoke a political discussion, first time I've encountered an issue like this.

Firefox gives this message:

Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site.

We can’t connect to the server at www.tammybaldwin.com.

If you entered the right address, you can: 

   Try again later    Check your network connection    Check that Firefox has permission to access the web (you might be connected but behind a firewall)

title: Cannot verify my device on Chase Bank's secure server
content:
I'm unable to verify my Mac to log into my Chase bank account, since I last cleaned out my cookies. When I enter my verification code and password, the fields revert to blank rather than submitting. I've cleaned my cache and cookies, restarted my browser, spoken to Chase reps... but it seems the issue is the browser. Firefox is the only browser I have this problem with.

It was suggested to me that Total Cookie Protection is not allowing Chase to verify, but I toggled off Enhanced Tracking Protection on the site, as well as adding exceptions as many of Chase's secure servers as I've seen (the exceptions in the attached screenshot go way past 7...), and I still can't verify and log in.
creator: ajakk

creator: vibrax_boy

title: Recupero segnalibri senza backup
content:
Buongiorno,

a causa di un aggiornamento del sistema operativo andato male, ho dovuto avviare il Mac con un HD esterno per salvare tutti i dati (non ho fatto backup di nulla, ovviamente) e ripristinare il computer alle condizioni di fabbrica.

Prima di ripristinare, però, mi chiedevo se ci fosse un modo per recuperare i segnalibri di Firefox come, ad esempio, una directory all'interno dell'HD originario.

Ho provato ad andare in: /Utenti/*nome*/Libreria/Caches/Mozilla/updates/Applications/Firefox

ma in "Caches" non c'è la cartella "Mozilla".

Grazie.
creator: aralsnowflake

title: history
content:
Two issues:

1. History is truncated, does not show all history even though Custom Settings set to remember. One google post said to 'delete all history upon closure' ... There are many, many posts from users having same issue.

2. Whatever history is being recorded is no longer simply a list (Ctrl-H) but is sorted into Today, Last Week etc. which is both annoying and makes searching for previously located site impossible unless you know WHEN you visited (unlikely).

Why was the changed? And why don't you change it back so when I select History, Show All History from task bar, Firefox would do just that?

title: Your browser is being managed by your organization
content: I can delete Mozilla HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\ and its gone as long as I don't reboot my computer, other wise its back again. I really don't understand the part stating who is managing by whom is this organization? I've been a long time user of Firefox so I would like to have this issue resolved as this my second attempt. I downloaded this file suggested by a member called policy_templates_v4.12.zip but at 73 years old and reading this nonsense imho is just not right. If I can't get this resolved soon I shall change browsers and it won't be Chrome that is for sure. I started with computers back 1989 long before the internet came along so due to bad health issues my memory is at best not great. Thanks for reading this and hopefully I can get an answer that will satisfy me as I love Firefox and really don't want to give up on it.
creator: hemi426

title: Stripe Payment Gateway
content: We use stripe as our payment processor on our website when collecting donations (https://effectivealtruism.org.au/). As of a couple of days ago, we are having multiple customers receiving the below error when they try to submit their payment (after entering all card details and completing the captcha). Stripe have advised that the issue is related to 3DS with our customers bank accounts. However, we think we have identified that this problem is actually related to customers using the Firefox browser. We have been able to process test donations with no issues using chrome but receive the same error using Firefox with the same card details.
creator: megan.goodwin
